Week 22-26

Second Trimester

Getting bigger & Better

Bump is getting a lot more noticeable. He is moving around and kicking like crazy!❤️ Getting a good night sleep is proving quite difficult for Laura but we're trying some remedies. We've had some amazing news that involves welcoming another bump into our group, even Marshmallow is jumping with joy!

Week 22 & 23

More bumps, birthdays and babies!

We found out that two of our very close friends, Jenn and Stephen, are also expecting their first baby! They told us on a birthday lunch for Laura and she cried her eyes out with happiness. As kids Jenn and Laura had always joked about getting pregnant at the same time so they could enjoy it together, little did they know it would actually happen!

They are due in April so there will be only a couple of months between our babies..very excited. I finally got to finally felt the baby move! It was amazing to feel and still surreal that there’s a baby in there.

Sleeping troubles!

Laura has started to have trouble sleeping, tossing and turning most nights and then fighting sleep throughout the day. She’s picked up a lavender sleep spray so hopefully this helps her sleep better…and me! We had Jenn’s surprise 30th birthday party this week and it was a great night. The following day we headed out to the baby fair where we put a deposit down on out cot and mattress and also picked up some cute baby bibs.

Week 24

It's all kicking off!

We had a hospital appointment this week, we were in the waiting room so long that I had to go back to work before Laura was seen. Finally, after hours of waiting Laura was in and out within 5 minutes and all went great. Laura had a little scan and baby is doing and looking great. We are now able to see when Marshmallow moves from the outside, it’s amazing! Laura was able to catch a video to show me because I haven't had the joy of seeing it yet... he seems a little shy around me!

Week 25 & 26

We got sick!

Another 30th Birthday this week, this time for Laura’s best friend Sarah. Another great night with friends. Unfortunately this week we both picked up the vomiting bug. I took the day off work to recover, the next day Laura caught it and was really ill. We were both worried about the baby so I stayed home again to keep an eye on Marshmallow and mammy.

24hours later we were both a lot better, Laura was able to drink much more water than yesterday and Marshmallow was still very active. She also had a routine check-up with her own doctor and got to hear Marshmallows heartbeat again! Marshmallow is measuring perfect!

Marshmallow's Measurements

Marshmallow may now be able to hear both our voices as we chat with each other. He's inhaling and exhaling small amounts of amniotic fluid, which is essential for the development of his lungs. Marshmallow is continuing to put on baby fat. He now weighs about 1 2/3 pounds and measures 14 inches (about the length of a butternut squash) from head to heel.
